attachments.title: Clever vs Insightful Code • Hillel Wayne
attachments.text: “Don’t write clever code.” Why not? “Because it’s hard to understand.” People who say this think of clever code such as Duff’s Device: Duff's Device send(to, from, count) register short *to, *from; register count; { register n = (count + 7) / 8; switch (count % 8) { case 0: do { *to = *from++; case 7: *to = *from++; case 6: *to = *from++; case 5: *to = *from++; case 4: *to = *from++; case 3: *to = *from++; case 2: *to = *from++; case 1: *to = *from++; } while (--n > 0); } } This code is “clever” because it exploits knowledge about the language, in this case the peculiarities of fall-through.
attachments.fallback: Hillel Wayne: Clever vs Insightful Code • Hillel Wayne
